alert.note: Alert for Ashland (Ohio) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 24 at 10:50AM EDT by NWS Cleveland
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL 1 PM EDT THIS AFTERNOON... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of north central Ohio, including the following county, Ashland. * WHEN...Until 100 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Numerous roads remain closed due to flooding. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 1049 AM EDT, emergency management reported multiple road closures across Ashland County. Flooding is ongoing or expected to begin shortly. Between 3 and 5 inches of rain have fallen. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Ashland, New London, Hayesville, Savannah, Polk, Jeromesville, Bailey Lakes, Nankin, Nova and Rowsburg. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
